channel.title: What Is The Best File Protector?
channel.description:
I am in dire need of a file protector. A file protector is a program that will make your files undeletable or password protected. If anyone knows one, please let me know.
Thank you, Leader

item.title: What Is The Best File Protector?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:10, topic:46468”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=64690.msg759701#msg759701 date=1168522736]

Thank you :). I don’t like cracking/doing illegal stuff except hacking :P, so I will search for it in stores or the Internet. I would give you credit, The Un-Named, but I don’t have 15 rep yet.[br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2007, 11:00:33 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Cheesehunk link=topic=64690.msg759512#msg759512 date=1168512002]
To be honest, making your own would probably be your best bet… I’ll give you some links to some I googled:

Easy File & Folder Protector
Advanced File Protector 2.2

Yeah, I looked it up in google before I came and asked on here. Thanks though.
[/quote]

Add me on msn then and I can ‘hook you up’ with a ‘legitimate pro installer’. :|:|
[/quote]

I had you added on there since SRL first started.[/quote]

Ah, sorry, didn’t know your MSN. Msg me when your next on(I have you added now).

Read full topic
item.source: What Is The Best File Protector?

item.title: What Is The Best File Protector?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Universal Shield Pro 4.1, find a crack for it, it can hide files(I mean properly hide, not right click -> hidden), stop them from being deleted, written and such, encrypt files and much more.

Read full topic
item.source: What Is The Best File Protector?

item.title: What Is The Best File Protector?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:5, topic:46468”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=64690.msg759539#msg759539 date=1168513518]
How about taking the disk drive out of your computer and putting it in a safer place ?
[/quote]

I did that, and about 6 months later when I plugged it back in, the HDD was corrupted =’([/quote]

I don’t mean actually taking it out of the casing. You have to turn off the computer, take out the casing, and put it on a motor. That way the read/write head doesn’t destroy it.

Read full topic
item.source: What Is The Best File Protector?
